nodes.bodyText: Packages need to be created in the store as well as part of this test?
Well I can have package names here, but they won't be deployable unless we have a package manager/store that can find them.
You can use the local store for now, which is being used by the IntegrationTest. When the design of store gets defined then we can change this.
Change this to be more restrictive. Certs with these policies are going to live (even though short lived) on different hosts and thats a risk. I would changes the Resource to be the Iot Thing ARN

May not be applicable for starters but, timeout should be taken as parameter and we should be able to create job without timeout. In my understanding when cloud service creates a job it is not going to put timeout. At some point we are also going to deployment when device gets offline after it receives the job.

Yeah, it should be configurable but I do want a timeout on our test resources so that they eventually are marked as failed/go away even if in production they won't have timeouts. I don't think that affects anything about how the job works, but let me know if I'm wrong.
Yes it does not affect how the jobs work.
Handle ThrottlingException for this and other resource CRUD operations in Iot? Add retries with backoff?
Dependencies are not needed in job document. This is a deprecated field. We get the dependencies from recipe.
Like how you do this. Would it better to take retryable exceptions as input? We want to retry in specific cases, not in all.
Flipped it to be retryable list instead of non-retryable list.
Are there existing libraries supporting the retry behavior?
Yes, but why bring in a library for 15 lines of code? We want to minimize our footprint.
This will run tests belonging to all groups?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -11,56 +11,74 @@ jobs:
   build:
     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
     steps:
-    - uses: actions/checkout@v2
-    - name: Decrypt the test Iot thing private key
-      run: ./.github/scripts/decrypt_iot_thing_private_key_and_cert.sh
-      env:
-        evergreen_test_iot_thing_private_key_secret_passphrase: ${{secrets.evergreen_test_iot_thing_private_key}}
-    - name: Set up JDK 1.8
-      uses: actions/setup-java@v1
-      with:
-        java-version: 1.8
-    - name: Configure AWS credentials
-      uses: aws-actions/configure-aws-credentials@v1
-      with:
-        aws-access-key-id: ${{ secrets.evergreen_dev_snapshot_access_key_id }}
-        aws-secret-access-key: ${{ secrets.evergreen_dev_snapshot_access_key_secret }}
-        aws-region: us-west-2
-    - name: Build with Maven
-      run: mvn -ntp verify
-    - name: Convert Jacoco to Cobertura
-      run: curl -o cover2cover.py https://gist.githubusercontent.com/MikeDombo/82567fccc1b2aced0c76fc053efd5a26/raw/f79f748f37cabb4cedd186321ea70e9fb383815d/cover2cover.py && python3 cover2cover.py target/jacoco-report/jacoco.xml src/main/java > target/jacoco-report/cobertura.xml
-    - name: Upload Coverage
-      uses: actions/upload-artifact@v1.0.0
-      with:
-        name: Coverage Report
-        path: target/jacoco-report
-    - name: cobertura-report
-      uses: 5monkeys/cobertura-action@master
-      continue-on-error: true
-      with:
-        # The GITHUB_TOKEN for this repo
-        repo_token: ${{ github.token }}
-        # Path to the cobertura file.
-        path: target/jacoco-report/cobertura.xml
-        # If files with 100% should be skipped from report.
-        skip_covered: false
-        # Minimum allowed coverage percentage as an integer.
-        minimum_coverage: 60
-        # Show line rate as specific column.
-        show_line: true
-        # Show branch rate as specific column.
-        show_branch: true
-        # Use class names instead of the filename
-        show_class_names: true
-    - name: Publish with Maven
-      run: mvn -ntp --settings settings.xml clean deploy -DskipTests=true -Daccess-key-id=${{ secrets.evergreen_dev_snapshot_access_key_id }} -Daccess-key-secret=${{ secrets.evergreen_dev_snapshot_access_key_secret }} -Dstargate-snapshot-repository-url=${{ secrets.stargate_dev_snapshot_repository_url }}
-      if: github.event_name == 'push'
-    - name: GitHub Actions Artifact Cleaner
-      uses: glassechidna/artifact-cleaner@v2
-      continue-on-error: true
-      with:
-        # Specify a minimum size of artifacts to delete in bytes. Artifacts smaller than this won't be deleted.
-        minimumDeletionSize: 0 # optional, default is 0
-        # Only delete artifacts older than this, measured in seconds.
-        minimumAge: 5184000 # optional, default is 0. Set to 5.184e+6 (60 days)
+      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
+      - name: Set up JDK 1.8
+        uses: actions/setup-java@v1
+        with:
+          java-version: 1.8
+      - name: Build with Maven
+        run: mvn -ntp verify

nodes.bodyText: No, as requested only unit and integ. E2E is separate.

nodes.bodyText: nit: change it to FILEPATH

We are going to use thing groups as targets when creating jobs using Iot Jobs. For individual devices we will use shadows (which is not implemented yet). So this will need to evolve to use Iot Thing groups. Don't want to block this PR because of this but add a TODO to make that change.
Sleep in else part and wait a bit before next query?
Can this be removed from your personal account?

nodes.bodyText: How to run this test from dev machine? How to set up the AWS credentials? Can you add a comment or readme on that?

nodes.bodyText: Thanks for cleaning this!
Nit: rename it to AwsIoTUtils to be more specific?
